newsitem.title: CHINA: Yuan closes down at one-month low vs US dollar.
newsitem.headline: Yuan closes down at one-month low vs US dollar.

text.p: The Chinese yuan continued to fall on Thursday, closing at a one-month low of 8.2962 from Wednesday's 8.2955 against the U.S. dollar in Shanghai, with more selling emerging at the 8.2950 level, dealers said.
The weighted average price on Wednesday was 8.2950.
The yuan opened higher at 8.2950 and consolidated around the opening level early in the trading, hitting an intraday high of 8.2947. It then fell to the 8.2960 level, hitting a low of 8.2967.
Trade was dull early and active late in the session with most transactions done at about 8.2957, dealers said.
"More selling emerged at the 8.2950 level after it failed to stand firm above that," said one dealer.

A second dealer said that although central bank intervention was not very clear in the Thursday session, it has played a key role in the market. "Recent falls have been triggered by worries about central bank intervention," he said.
Dealers said they expected the yuan to move around 8.2960 on Friday.
The yuan closed down at 6.8245 from 6.7905 against 100 Japanese yen and down at an intraday low of 1.0722 from 1.0718 against the Hong Kong dollar.
